intro: Racosperma consobrinum, commonly known as the broad-leafed acacia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant features bipinnate leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. It produces yellow flowers arranged in dense, cylindrical spikes. Racosperma consobrinum is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
